customer_addr:
S-2986-A Garner Hill Road
Hillsboro, WI 54634

citations.narrative:
Dog #119 and dog #115 were missing their tags during inspection. Dog #119's tag was found in the enclosure with a
broken chain-type collar. The representative said dog #115's tag was noticed lost about a week ago and hasn't been
found. Proper official identification is required and needs to be worn on each dog with a safe collar. Proper identification is
important to help with husbandry tracking of animals. Ensure to maintain each dog's official identification attached with a
safe collar as required.

The enclosure for a female golden retriever closest to the east door has a row of chain link with points that she could
touch. Wire points can cause injury. Ensure that enclosures/pens are maintained so that there are no sharp points that
animals could contact.
Note: Item was corrected at time of exit interview.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The exercise area which the representative said is used to let dogs run in while cleaning their pens has some overgrown
areas of weeds that include burdock and thistle. Overgrown weeds can make it difficult to keep the exercise area clean.
Burdock and thistle can get in dogs' hair and cause matting/discomfort. Ensure to maintain plants in the exercise area in a
manner that helps promote the health and wellbeing of the dogs that use it.
Note: Burdock and thistle were removed from exercise area prior to exit interview.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections by 10/21/2023 or applicant forfeits the license fee and must
wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires (9/26/2023).
n

narrative:
2.50  Repeat
   
Time and method of identification. 
Dog #119 and dog #115 were missing their tags during inspection. Dog #119's tag was found in the enclosure with a 
broken chain-type collar. The representative said dog #115's tag was noticed lost about a week ago and hasn't been 
found. Proper official identification is required and needs to be worn on each dog with a safe collar. Proper identification is 
important to help with husbandry tracking of animals. Ensure to maintain each dog's official identification attached with a 
safe collar as required. 
3.1(c)(1)(ii)  Repeat
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The enclosure for a female golden retriever closest to the east door has a row of chain link with points that she could 
touch. Wire points can cause injury. Ensure that enclosures/pens are maintained so that there are no sharp points that 
animals could contact.  
Note: Item was corrected at time of exit interview. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The exercise area which the representative said is used to let dogs run in while cleaning their pens has some overgrown 
areas of weeds that include burdock and thistle. Overgrown weeds can make it difficult to keep the exercise area clean. 
Burdock and thistle can get in dogs' hair and cause matting/discomfort. Ensure to maintain plants in the exercise area in a 
manner that helps promote the health and wellbeing of the dogs that use it.  
Note: Burdock and thistle were removed from exercise area prior to exit interview. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections by 10/21/2023 or applicant forfeits the license fee and must 
wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.

Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires (9/26/2023).
